title: Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT
short_description: Accelerate network detection and response with Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT - a cloud-native, high-velocity NDR solution.
description:
[Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT](https://www.gigamon.com/products/detect-respond/gigamon-threatinsight.html?utm_campaign=cisco&utm_source=ti-module&utm_medium=referral) accelerates network detection and response (NDR) via a cloud-native platform that leverages machine learning and [Gigamon Applied Threat Research](https://www.gigamon.com/research/applied-threat-research-team.html?utm_campaign=cisco&utm_source=ti-module&utm_medium=referral) (ATR) to provide threat activity detection, data and context needed for response and investigation in a rapidly transforming cyber security landscape.

This SaaS solution provides the analytics and threat-management capabilities you need to proactively prioritize, mitigate and hunt down today's threats:
-  **Find hidden threats.** Discover threats in encrypted communications and improve your overall security hygiene.
- **Automate investigations and responses.** Prioritize and rank incidents to focus your people on the riskiest incidents and assets.
-  **Optimize workflows and tracking.** Go from reactive to proactive tracking and mitigation, tracking threats even during change.
tips:
When configuring the Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT integration, you must first gather some information from your Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT account.

1. Log into Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT, click **Settings Icon** and choose **Profile Settings**.
2. Click **Create New Token**, provide a **Description** and click **Create**.
3. Copy the **Token** into a file, or leave the tab open. **Important:** Do not close the dialog without retrieving the token; the token is not retrievable once the dialog is closed.
4. Deploy [Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT Serverless Relay](https://github.com/CiscoSecurity/tr-05-gigamon-threatinsight#gigamon-threatinsight-relay-api)
5. Complete the **Add New Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT Module** form:
    - **Module Name** - Leave the default name or enter a name that is meaningful to you.
    - **URL** - The URL of the Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT Serverless Relay.
    - **API KEY** - Enter the Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT API Key.
    - **CTR ENTITIES LIMIT** - Enter the limit that restricts the maximum number of CTIM entities of each type returned in a single response per each requested observable. Must be a positive integer. Defaults to 100 (if unset or incorrect). Has the upper bound of 1000 to avoid getting overwhelmed with too much data, so any greater values are still acceptable but also limited at the same time.
    - **GTI_ALLOW_TEST_ACCOUNTS** - Allows fake data from the test accounts (Demo and Training) to be returned along with real data (if enabled). Must be 1 - if allow or 0 - if not. Defaults to 0 (if unset or incorrect).
6. Click **Save** to complete the Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT module configuration.

configuration_spec.label: CTR ENTITIES LIMIT
configuration_spec.tooltip: Restricts the maximum number of `Indicators` and `Sightings`

configuration_spec.label: GTI ALLOW TEST ACCOUNTS
configuration_spec.tooltip: Allows fake data from the test accounts (Demo and Training)

capabilities.description: Performs health check against Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT API.
Query Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT for IP, Domain, MD5, SHA1, and SHA256 return Sighting and Indicator.
Pivot on IP, Domain, MD5, SHA1, and SHA256 to the Gigamon ThreatINSIGHT UI.
